physical_appearance:The image shows a photograph in black-and-white. It has a black frame and its border is white in colour. There is a black line before the border that serves as the photograph\u0027s perimeter. At the bottom of the photograph
 three sets of railroads are visible. One of them is occupied by a train. At the middle of the photograph
 an expressway can be seen. Beyond the expressway
 a port containing numerous freight containers stacked on top of one another can be seen. Four cranes overlooking the water body are displayed as well.

subject_terms_3:Rail transport Tanjong Pagar Railway Station Pertadbiran Keretapi Tanah Melayu Tanjong Pagar Terminal Photography Rail transport (Stations)
sgcool_label_text:\This image features the container terminals at Tanjong Pagar
 which the railway station is located next to. It is part of the \\Tracking Memories\\ collection by the late Mr Kwek Leng Joo. The collection captures different aspects of the Malayan Railway story in Singapore

metadata.physical_appearance: The image shows a photograph in black-and-white. It has a black frame and its border is white in colour. There is a black line before the border that serves as the photograph's perimeter. At the bottom of the photograph, three sets of railroads are visible. One of them is occupied by a train. At the middle of the photograph, an expressway can be seen. Beyond the expressway, a port containing numerous freight containers stacked on top of one another can be seen. Four cranes overlooking the water body are displayed as well.

metadata.subject_terms_2: Black-and-white photography Railroads Railroad passenger cars Express highways Freight and freightage Harbours Pertadbiran Keretapi Tanah Melayu Tanjong Pagar (Singapore) Railroad trains
metadata.subject_terms_3: Rail transport Tanjong Pagar Railway Station Pertadbiran Keretapi Tanah Melayu Tanjong Pagar Terminal Photography Rail transport (Stations)
metadata.sgcool_label_text: "This image features the container terminals at Tanjong Pagar, which the railway station is located next to. It is part of the ""Tracking Memories"" collection by the late Mr Kwek Leng Joo. The collection captures different aspects of the Malayan Railway story in Singapore
